messages.subject: Fwd: Homeschooling Documentary
messages.messageBody:
>Date: 26 Apr 00 09:41:30 MDT
>From: Fernanda Rossi <magafilms@...>
>To: magafilms@...
>Subject: Homeschooling Documentary
>
>Please read and forward.
>----------------------------
>JUST RELEASED!
>First documentary on homeschooling
>
>"INVENTING A GIRL"
>
>Available for screenings now
>For more info:
>
>www.inventingagirl.com/released.html
>----------------------------
>People say...
>
>"I loudly applaud Ms. Rossiís efforts to share this unique approach to
>living and learning, to bring new understanding about homeschooling to a
>wider audience."
>Helen Heneger - Editor,
>Home Education Magazine
>
>
>
>"ëInventing a Girlí is the first documentary to explore homeschooling from
>an objective perspective. I am confident that Ms. Rossiís in-depth
>approach will encourage parents and educate educators."
>Nancy Plent,
>Unschoolers Network
>
>
>
>"This documentary sheds needed light regarding homeschooling. And in the
>hands of filmmaker Fernanda Rossi the nature of this issue is revealed for
>what truly is: an aspect of educating that is challenging and exciting."
>Ernest W. Wiggins ñ Professor,
>Communications Department
>Kean University, New Jersey
>
>
>
>"An informed and intimate look at the daily life of Lily Borenstein-Burd,
>a nine year old who has never been to school, the film raises some
>important questions about our system of education. This documentary not
>only increase public knowledge of homeschooling, but also helps those
>families looking for alternative ways to educate their children."
>William Sanchez ñ Producer,
>WNJN - New Jersey
>
>____________________________________________________________________
